required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Expanded Controlled Study of Safety and Efficacy of MCI-186 in Patients With Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS)
clinical_study.official_title: An Expanded Controlled Study of MCI-186 for Treatment of Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis in Double-Blind, Parallel-Group, Placebo-Controlled Manner (Phase 3)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a long-term, double-blind, placebo-controlled study of MCI-186 to treat ALS. This study is the long-term extension of Study NCT00330681; Study NCT00330681 is a Phase 3, randomized, double-blind, placebo control, parallel assignment, 24-week study in the treatment of ALS. The objectives of this study are to assess the efficacy and safety of long-term intermittent therapy with 60 mg MCI-186 to ALS patients.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Revised ALS Functional Rating Scale (ALSFRS-R) Score in Full Analysis Set (FAS) Population at 24 Weeks
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline (seventh cycle) and at 24 week (twelfth cycle)
primary_outcome.description: 0=worst; 48=best To investigate the sustainability of effects of edaravone, the analysis focusing on the comparison between the placebo and edaravone groups of patients who had received 6 cycles of edaravone treatment, i.e., the comparison of data from Cycles 7 to 12 between the edaravone-edaravone group and the edaravone-placebo group, was performed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Death or a Specified State of Disease Progression
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 weeks (from seventh cycle to twelfth cycle)
secondary_outcome.description: Any of "death, disability of independent ambulation, loss of upper arm function, tracheotomy, use of respirator, and use of tube feeding" was defined as an event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in % Forced Vital Capacity (%FVC) in Full Analysis Set (FAS) Population at 24 Weeks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline (seventh cycle) and at 24 week (twelfth cycle)
secondary_outcome.description: To investigate the sustainability of effects of edaravone, the analysis focusing on the comparison between the placebo and edaravone groups of patients who had received 6 cycles of edaravone treatment, i.e., the comparison of data from Cycles 7 to 12 between the edaravone-edaravone group and the edaravone-placebo group, was performed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 36 weeks (from seventh cycle to fifteenth cycle)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Drug Reactions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 36 weeks (from seventh cycle to fifteenth cycle)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Laboratory Tests for Which the Incidence of Abnormal Changes Was 5% or Higher in Either Group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 36 weeks (from seventh cycle to fifteenth cycle)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Abnormal Changes in Sensory Examinations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 36 weeks (from seventh cycle to fifteenth cycle)

intervention.description: Two ampoules (60 mg) of MCI-186 injection are intravenously administered once a day for 10 days during 14 days, followed by 14 days observation period (first cycle). Then treatment (10 days' administration during 14 days ) - observation (14 days) cycle is repeated eight times.

Two ampoules of placebo injection are intravenously administered once a day for 10 days during 14 days, followed by 14 days observation period (first cycle). Then treatment (10 days' administration during 14 days) - observation (14 days) cycle is repeated eight times.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who ware completed drug administration without discontinuation in the preceding confirmatory study NCT00330681.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with such complications as Parkinson's disease, schizophrenia, dementia, renal failure, or other severe complication, and patients who have the anamnesis of hypersensitivity to edaravone.
- Patients whose creatinine clearance is 50mL/min or less at the time of completion of drug administration in the study NCT00330681.
- Pregnant, lactating, and probably pregnant patients, and patients who want to become pregnant, and patients who can not agree to contraception.
- Patients who are participating in other clinical trials except the study NCT00330681.
- In addition to the above exclusion criteria, patients judged to be inadequate to participate in this study by their physician.

overall_official.affiliation: Graduate School of Medicine and Dentistry, Okayama University

facility.name: National Hospital Organization Miyagi National Hospital

results_reference.citation: WRITING GROUP ON BEHALF OF THE EDARAVONE (MCI-186) ALS 17 STUDY GROUP. Exploratory double-blind, parallel-group, placebo-controlled extension study of edaravone (MCI-186) in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis. Amyotroph Lateral Scler Frontotemporal Degener. 2017 Oct;18(sup1):20-31. doi: 10.1080/21678421.2017.1362000.

group.title: MCI-186 - Placebo of MCI-186
group.description: Cycles 7 to 12 (6 cycles) : 2 ampoules of edaravone injection placebo administered once daily over 60 minutes by intravenous infusion Cycles 13 to 15 (3 cycles) : 2 ampoules of edaravone injection 30 mg administered once daily over 60 minutes by intravenous infusion
